etymology.description: Pictogram — a horn; conservative form 𧢲; similar but unrelated to 甬, 用, and the bottom part of 備.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an animal horn in profile, with a pointed tip and base; early forms were more pictorial, as seen in 𧢲. The simplified, angular strokes still evoke a horn and by extension an angle or corner.

examples.chinese: 公牛的角很大(公牛的角很大)。
三角形有三个角(三角形有三個角)。
这枚硬币是一角钱(這枚硬幣是一角錢)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè méi yìngbì shì yī jiǎo qián.
examples.english: This coin is one jiao (0.1 yuan).
